benchmark_details.name: CodeMixBench
benchmark_details.overview: CodeMixBench is a novel benchmark designed to evaluate the robustness of large language models on code generation from code-mixed prompts, supporting Hinglish, Spanish-English, and Chinese Pinyin-English.
benchmark_details.data_type: code generation tasks with code-mixed prompts

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation framework for studying multilingual code generation and evaluate model robustness in code-mixed scenarios.

data.source: Augmentation of BigCodeBench with controlled code-mixing for multilingual prompts.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using LLM-driven augmentation pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Pass@1 checks if the top-1 generated solution passes all associated test cases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pass@1 indicates better performance in generating valid code under varying code-mixing conditions.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance comparisons between code-mixed prompts and English-only prompts.
methodology.validation: Results validated by executing generated code within isolated environments.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark focuses on code-mixing in multilingual communities but lacks demographic breakdowns.
